question:
Consider the following differences between Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes:
  1. While Type -1 diabetes results when body doesn’t produce enough insulin, in Type -2 diabetes body produces insulin
  2. While Type-1 diabetes develops most often in young people, Type-2 diabetes develops most often in middle-aged and older people.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Type 1 diabetes, is also called juvenile diabetes because it develops most often in young people; however, type 1 diabetes can also develop in adults. Type 2 diabetes, which used to be called adult-onset diabetes, begins with insulin resistance—a condition that occurs when fat, muscle, and liver cells do not use insulin to carry glucose into the body’s cells to use for energy.
